intro: Caladeniastrum unitum, commonly known as the slender spider orchid, is a species of orchid native to southeastern Australia. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, intricate flowers that resemble spiders, hence its common name. The plant typically blooms in spring, producing pale yellow or greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive, hooded labellum. It grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in heathland or open forests. Caladeniastrum unitum is a rare and delicate species, requiring specific environmental conditions for successful growth and reproduction.
